name: Hilton Santa Cruz / Scotts Valley

reviews.text: This Hilton is so nice and quiet. It is only a 5 min drive to the boardwalk. Nice to stay in the forest and be so close to the ocean. Service was great. But the shower pressure not very strong. We will be back.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We were unable to get something right on the beach because we made last minute plans. Researched some sites and found that 3 stars at Priceline got you the Hilton. Most of the hotels in Santa Cruz are old and are really showing their age. The Hilton was vibrant, clean, and very quiet. Easy access right off of the freeway, plenty of parking. They have a restaurant onsite, we had room service one night and it was pretty good.
reviews.title: Long Weekend in Santa Cruz

reviews.text: For real coffee, go back onto the main street and go into Scotts Valley. About a mile from the Hilton on the right hand side is a Peet's Coffee.
reviews.title: Solid Choice for the Santa Cruz/Scotts Valley Area

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Scotts Valley for a three day business trip in the area. I liked the French chateau type exterior of the place and the lobby was large and inviting as well The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful when I needed recommendations and directions for dining options around town. By the way, be sure to eat at Shadowbrook restaurant in Capitola, which is about a 10 or 15 minute drive from the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was spacious and spotlessly clean with a mini-fridge, coffeemaker, small sofa, upholstered chair, coffee table, flat-screen TV work desk and chair, and a comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was of a better than average size as well.
reviews.title: Hidden treasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You've driven up US 101 from SoCal to Santa Cruz; and having had enough of beach prices and fog, you decide to head a short way up State Route 17 to find some reasonable sunshine. So exit at Mt. Hermon Road (about 15 minutes from its starting ramp off of Route 1), turn left at La Madrona Drive, and ease on over to the big Hilton facility thereon. This is a very up to date hostelry, with huge windows for gazing at the lovely trees and wooded slopes of this entryway to the Santa Cruz Mountains wine-and-pine Wonderland.
reviews.title: Hilton In The Hills

reviews.text: With a spacious entryway and lobby, a decent little restaurant and pub just off to the right of the check-in desk, and well-furnished rooms in the standard Hilton style, this reasonably priced hotel is an excellent choice -- especially if you plan eventually to drive on over Route 17 North to Silicon Valley and San Francisco.
reviews.title: I really wanted to love this place, but....

reviews.text: I really wanted to love this place, but I had a poor experience that really impacted my stay, and that experience weighed heavily on my overall rating of my stay.
reviews.title: THE PERFECT GET AWAY

reviews.text: I stayed here for the first time last weekend while I was in town for business. My wife and 4 year old daughter traveled with me. The property is located right off the freeway, and there are a couple eateries within walking distance. There is a restaurant at the hotel as well, although it does not offer a complimentary breakfast. The hotel does not even offer complimentary water or coffee in the lobby. The hotel itself is very clean, the architecture is beautiful, and the grounds are meticulously maintained. The rooms are good size, and the beds are comfortable. There is ample parking in the parking lot, and parking is free. One of the reasons I chose this hotel is because it has an outdoor heated pool and hot tub, which is a huge plus when traveling with a young child.
reviews.title: A comfortable quiet place to stay while visiting Santa Cruz.

reviews.text: After a long day at work, I was looking forward to taking a swim with my daughter and then unwinding in the hot tub with my wife. However, when I got to the pool area, a group of about nine drunk young men and women had overtaken it. I question whether or not they were even of legal age to consume alcohol. The group had apparently set up shop at the pool with an ice chest full of liquor and beer, and were drinking their alcoholic beverages in both the pool and the hot tub.
reviews.title: best hilton experience
Loved the Hilton Scotts Valley
reviews.text: Great Hotel..good location, always have friendly service.

Stayed here for two nights in May while attending a family function in Los Gatos (approximately a 15-20 minute drive). The hotel is located just off the main highway to Santa Cruz but you hear no road noise in the rooms. Parking at the hotel is either self or complimentary valet. We used both. The parking lot is small and located directly in front of the hotel so it's not a far walk if you do self parking. Check-in was a bit slow, but seamless. The front desk seamed busy due to a wedding party that was staying at the hotel and because of Mother's Day weekend. We booked using Hilton Honors points so I can't comment on the price of the rooms, but as Hilton Diamond members, we were upgraded to a lovely suite upon check-in. It was on the first floor of the hotel, but I think this is a criticism of the hotel layout, not the front desk staff. The suite was nicely appointed, extremely spacious and had nice toiletries. The bathroom was enormous and featured dual sinks and a separate bath and shower enclosure. The vouchers for breakfast that we received entitled us to only the continental breakfast (value of $6.95) which was a little uncommon for Diamond members. Typically we receive the hot breakfast option so we had to make do with cereal, fruit, pastries, yogurt and toast. We found the hotel to be not very soundproof. We could hear water running in the rooms above ours as well as doors closing and noise from the hallway. We used the pool while we were there and it was very nice. They have cabanas situated around the pool which was nice for lounging. Overall it was a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Lovely Location

reviews.text: Stayed here last week for one night. Clean and nice but a high end Hilton. Great staff. Room was clean and quiet. Will stay here again. Ten minutes from the city of Santa Cruz.
reviews.title: Nice property just minutes from Santa Cruz

reviews.text: Upon checkin - Not at all helpful - extremeley professional - NO attempt to provide customer service - said such things as "we can't answer phones - we are too slammed!" and "we're full - you can't expect your room to be ready!" Not the best way to represent Hilton - ruins the experience from the start of the stay... Will contact management, but just wanted to warn others!
reviews.title: Terrible front desk experience

reviews.text: The location wasn't that far fom beaches and dt Santa Cruz, it was a beautiful property I just felt very strip mallish. In saying that the staff and everyone there was amazing. Price was a bit high but it was a nice trip. During the week stays are often cheaper.
reviews.title: Nice get away from the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet location outside of Santa Cruz, great swimming pool area, nice staff, comfortable bed and cheap breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Our family of four (two under eight) stayed here at the end of March. The hotel grounds and rooms are what we expected from a Hilton - clean and well-appointed. We had dinner at their onsite restaurant and everyone was satisfied with their meals. What sets this hotel apart from others we've stayed at is their outstanding customer service. From check-in to check-out the front desk customer service went above and beyond and was the best we've ever encountered. Our room was also very clean and inviting. We would definitely stay here again if we're ever in the area.
reviews.title: Delivered What We Expected And Then Some...

reviews.text: If you are a Hilton Hhonors member, you will be treated like royalty! I was upgraded to a beautiful suite with a fireplace upon checking in. The setting is hillside for a nice quiet stay. The property is always clean, and staff are super friendly. My only complaint is the meager Hhonors breakfast buffet...not much of a variety; however, the food is good, hot, and plentiful. If you are in the Santa Cruz area, stay at the Hilton in Scotts Valley !
reviews.title: Love this Hilton Property!

reviews.text: My hubby and my teen daughter stayed here during a college road trip. We had been on road for 7+ hours, tired, hungry. We tried to find someplace to eat on the way, but decided to just eat at the hotel.
reviews.title: 5 star stay, friendly staff

reviews.text: The front desk was welcoming and friendly. May I say I really appreciate a welcoming smile? It means something folks. I like it. It sets the mood from the moment my tired family walked in.
reviews.title: GOOD LOCATION OUTSIDE SANTA CRUZ

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely. They had just finished up an event, always a stressful time. But the place was clean and staff still friendly. Our room was well laid out, and we got an upgrade plus I get free wifi as a Hilton Honors member.
reviews.title: Really nice Hilton.

aka: Hilton Santa Cruz / Scotts Valley Hotel Santa Cruz
